SENT.plain: The transplantation program with cadaveric organs has been ongoing at our institution for more than 40 years, since 1965
The purpose of this report was to analyze changes in the donor population and causes of death over the years
This retrospective analysis of donor records between 1977 and 2005, included 1331 donors
Since 1977, the number of donors has remained unchanged, but their profile has changed
The median donor age today has almost doubled, from 30 to nearly 60 years
Early on the most common cause of death was head trauma and the majority of donors were men
Since the mid-1980s, the main cause of death was intracerebral hemorrhage or cerebral thrombosis and the gender distribution became equal
The number of procured and transplanted organs from each donor has increased, despite an increased donor age
The multi-organ donor rate exceeded 80% in the beginning of this decade; we retrieved 3.9 organs per donor
These results may be explained by improved organ donor care and organization, and by increased awareness of potential donors among elderly patients
